comments.body: I made a post like this with Peregrine Falcons carrying bundles back to perch blocks in bases. I like the idea of Falcons hunting fish by swooping down. I don‚Äôt think wild falcons should be able to be tamed but instead they should be more like foxes that trust you.
Maybe when you tame the wolf üê∫ you could get the dog breeds that you talked about?
If you go in the nether will the chameleon detect ancient debris?
Where in the jungle will they be found?
Nearly everywhere in the jungle
does the chameleon kill silverfish
I really love this idea! I would love to see narwhals in the game, and I think the ice farming is an interesting idea for their use.
Nice idea. And it actually has a practical use, unlike most mob suggestions.
Other than the ingots, this is a great idea.
I feel like Otters would be SO adorable, but Mojang wants creatures to have a use as well rather than just be cute
I think Marine Iguanas would be cool as they also can swim.
What about Komodo Dragons? They would be a great endangered mob added to Minecraft! Hopefulllllly!

That is also a good idea.
I especially like the ideas of Komodo Dragon and Marine Iguana.
They could also be made differently, with the center iron block being replaced with a Blast Furnace and the Pumpkin being replaced with a melon

Replying to 406280981491 yes! that is also a good idea, the only reason I thought against it, is to keep the first two golems relevant. Since what would be the point of making a snow golem if it already does more than a melon golem and same with the iron furnace golem

Each Golems should be summoned separately, and the Snow Pumpkin Golem should spawn naturally in Snow Villages.

The Furnace Golem should have a 25% chance to spawn in a desert village instead of an Iron Golem as this is the only village where there is no chance of causing a fire. You have to remember that he is stronger, but also more risky, by playing with fire.

Apart from that, Golems should not attack other Golems.

I have an egg farm, and one time I filled my entire inventory with eggs and attacked my friend. I swear I had hundreds of chickens spawn. It was so much that it started to lag, imagine if they followed me around, lmao
Sounds like a great mod idea!
When I made this i hade no clue about the dungeons and dragons card game  lol!
if someone makes this a mod, please make it on bedrock
Dungeons and dragons is a hugely popular tabletop roleplaying game and if it was made into a minecraft update, there would be serious copyright issues.
I would have these be an adult form of the endermite

IRL, elytra are not the wings of beetles, just the hard part that covers their real wings. Because of this, the Elytra Beetle should have the elytra open but then have 2D transparent wings pop out which flap rapidly which allow them to actually fly instead of just glide

As elytra are the hard coverings for wings, they should act like armor to the Elytra Beetles, possibly making them impervious to arrows like shulkers when they are closed, but also making it so they can't fly or move at all. They can be hit with arrows when the elytra are open, but the elytra on their backs may also get damaged, rendering it useless
They could also be called End/erbeetles or Endibles

People have been wanting elytra to be added on top of armor, but as it is a hard covering for wings it could be made to be a type of armor itself. It could make it so the players back is impervious to arrows when closed. Turtle Shells could also be placed on the chestplate to do the same

As endermites are like the end-version of silverfish, they could infest Shulkers and then transform their shell into the elytra. They could also leave the shulker shell as an empty shulker box and fly away, but I am not sure about that.

One idea I had was that you could shear the wings off of them making them unable to fly, but that seems a bit too easy to farm. More likely, I think they should just have a rare chance to drop them. Either way, they should always drop a damaged elytra.
Or perhaps it can be tamed as a source of transportation in the end that is endless... Unlike elytra wings.

These could be found in a new area of end ships, as ‚Äúcargo‚Äù this makes much more sense than there being a random item frame with elytra in them for no apparent reason (shulkers don‚Äôt need them) also another new mob could explain who built the end cities and who‚Äôs ships they are (perhaps a parallel to the piglin mob) this shouldn‚Äôt be the enderman and should not spawn on the original island or outside of end cities.
Very nice. However I think these could become sea pillagers instead.
Cristo
Hrh

Honestly one of the features I want to see the most.

They could also be afraid of light sources to imitate how roaches tend to stick to darker areas.

Maybe they could also possibly gather together in places with more roaches when they're not scouting around for food to imitate the way roaches nest.
They should spawn in under a torch level light.

I had this idea too!

I think thorny devils should spawn on the surface in the red-desert/mesa/badlands biomes. They should be semi-passive like spiders: In the day they should hunt/sunbathe, but after sunset they should become sleepy and passive (because reptiles are cold blooded). They could be like the dry counterpart to axolotls (another small, cute, endangered reptile). I do not think thorny devils should be tameable by the player, but they could be breaded by the player using spiders eye? Naturally, thorny devils would have the thorns effect innately, so anything that hits them would take damage from the thorns.

Thanks for reading! I hope this little guy gets added, maybe at the same time as the "vulture" mob.
they could also have thicker ice wardrobe similar to the strays maybe?
And you could catch them in a bottle and have a light source.
I LOVE this idea! But this mob seems a little too tough.
we could add this in a new update.
A pet Tortoise would be epic!  Although, I do believe this mob has been suggested before..  I really hope it doesn‚Äôt get taken down!
I would love tortoises especially ones you could tame
Mmm, Tortoise
I agree with you that the warden should have more than 1 attack so it would be a proper mini boss/boss

So I was thinking that this boss like creature though powerful is pretty easily cheesed (easily beating something by abusing game mechanics ). and that is building a three block high tower then hitting it a few times till it dies.

 

my suggestion is giving it a three block jump with a semi short cool down!

I just really want everyone to get a terrifyingly fun experience!

Give them a list of abilities that would be randomly chosen for each Warden. Not every Warden will have all the abilities that are possible, but each Warden will have its own skill set.

Naturally, players won't know what this or that Warden can do. Even if they get away from a Warden one time and it despawns, they can't ever be sure their previous tactic will save them the next time. Each Warden will be unique.

Here's some ideas for for what all Wardens might have the ability to do:

* It could jump as high as a Goat

* It could climb blocks like a Spider

* It could teleport like a Enderman

* It could turn Invisible like a Wander Trader + Invisibility Potion

* It could crawl through a one-block gap like a Baby Zombie

* It could move fast like a Baby Zombie

* It could float to the ground like a Chicken

* If you hit it with a fishing rod, it will pull *you* in

* It could attack the player with a Blindness effect (that's in addition to the pulsating darkness)

* It could radiate an Aura of Anti-Magic (none of your enchantments work while you're within range, and you can't use or throw potions) (Totem of Undying still works though)

* It could radiate an Aura of Anti-Placement‚Äîthis needs a better name (you can't place any new blocks in the world while you're within range)
I think it would be really cool if there was a second angrier phase that activates after 5 mins of its spawn that would make it able to sprint. Imagine the fear of running away from that creature.
It should spawn in zombie villages
In this case, developers can add the mechanics of chopping off limbs, for example, using enchantments. If it's too brutal, then it can only be applied to a specific group of mobs, such as undead.
Then how else are we supposed to get tridents?
They shouldn't spawn less. They should just do less damage. We still need tridents.
Perhaps the best nerf would be to make them attack slower. Also, they are NOT that rare.

They definitely need their attack power nerfed, they are not rare and spawn frequently. I've died so many times even in Normal-mode survival and it's very frustrating and discouraging that you're not even safe in a boat.
YES
YES

I would absolutly love this. I am playing Minecraft for years now and the combat has never grown on me, it stresses me out. Minecraft for me is a chill Sandbox game and i would really like getting items like string for a fishing rod oder bones to tame dog easier, not to mention the brewing and end-game items like shulker boxes! Is there any way to play in that fashion on Bedrock Edition on Consoles?

And not to be missunderstoud: The old peaceful mode should stay for the poeple who just do not want the mobs around. I would just love a new gamemode in this fashion (maybe with hunger too? But that is not as important for me)!
Yes all hostile mobs being neutral in peaceful

Most new challenges should have an upside too.  I saw a video recently, for instance, where someone modded termites.  Termites ate wood but occasionally dropped whole block (for a very slow wood farm) and otherwise dropped sawdust, which could, I think, fertilize some crops.  You might want to add a mechanic like that to this.
